meanings.definition: A formal combat between two persons, usually with weapons, in accordance with certain rules.
meanings.sent1: The duelling between the knights was a spectacle of honor and bravery.
meanings.sent2: Duelling was a common way to settle disputes in the past.
meanings.sent3: The duelling over who gets the last cookie was intense but friendly.
meanings.sent4: The duelling of ideas in the debate was fierce and captivating.
meanings.sent5: The duelling under the moonlight left a lasting impression on all who witnessed it.

meanings.sent1: He was duelling with his rival for the title of champion.
meanings.sent2: Duelling is considered a risky way to resolve conflicts.
meanings.sent3: She was duelling with her brother over who could run faster.
meanings.sent4: The politicians were duelling with words in the heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The duelling of swords echoed through the courtyard as the duel began.
